page.title: 15Quakerism in Pennington
page.content: The Quakers were a religious group, also known as Friends.The Quakers held Meetings.They did not have talks,or sing,at their Meetings.They would pray to God in their minds and wait for God's presence to enter them. They wore simple black clothing.They would not fight,but they helped the injured and they helped refugees. Sometimes they would be thrown into prison for their beliefs.When a war was on and people asked them to fight for their country and they would not, other people teased and threatened the Friends. Some Quakers emigrated to Pennsylvania,USA because they were treated so badly.Many left to escape persecution and some left because of the high taxes,such as the light tax and the hearth tax.
